page.title: 05FARMING BISHOP THORNTON
page.content: The farming carried out in this area is mainly dairy farming. The soil is Harrogate clay and is unsuitable for growing crops although some of the land has been drained and is planted with rye grass for silage. There are a few fields of barley and one of potatoes. The rest is pasture and meadows for grazing. There are 30 farms in our area. The biggest farm is Kirby's with 140 acres. They have 200 Friesan dairy cows, 250 bullocks and 100 heifers. They breed calves, make their own silage and make 1000 bales of hay every year. There are 5 sheep farms, 2 pig farms, 3 poultry farms and the rest are dairy farms. Some farmers keep a few chickens, ducks and pigs for their own use. One farmer breeds pheasantsfor shooting on his land.
